title: Unable to brew install on OS X
body:
Apologies if this is the wrong place to pos this issue - I couldn't find any maintainer contact listed against the brew formula.

I get an SSL error from curl when I try to `brew install golang`. Heres the trace:

```
$ brew install golang
==> Downloading https://homebrew.bintray.com/bottles/go-1.7.el_capitan.bottle.ta

curl: (51) SSL: certificate verification failed (result: 5)
Error: Failed to download resource "go"
Download failed: https://homebrew.bintray.com/bottles/go-1.7.el_capitan.bottle.tar.gz
Warning: Bottle installation failed: building from source.
==> Using the sandbox
==> Downloading https://storage.googleapis.com/golang/go1.7.src.tar.gz
Already downloaded: /Users/jamesstidard/Library/Caches/Homebrew/go-1.7.tar.gz
==> Downloading https://storage.googleapis.com/golang/go1.7.darwin-amd64.tar.gz

curl: (51) SSL: certificate verification failed (result: 5)
Error: Failed to download resource "go--gobootstrap"
Download failed: https://storage.googleapis.com/golang/go1.7.darwin-amd64.tar.gz
```
